org.actus.contracts

Class ContractType

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.actus.contracts.ContractType

  • public final class ContractType
extends Object
    A representation of an ACTUS Contract Type algorithm

    ACTUS Contract Types represent classes of financial instrument payoff functions. This component is a representation of the algorithm mapping a set of attributes (cf. ContractModelProvider), an external market model (cf. RiskFactorModelProvider) and analysis times (cf. analysisTimes) onto a vector of contingent contract events (cf. ContractEvent).

    See Also:
    ACTUS

    • Method Detail

      • lifecycle

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> lifecycle(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,
                                                 ContractModelProvider model,
                                                 RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel)
                                          throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                                 AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates the contingent lifecycle of the contract

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of contract events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type and contingent to the risk factor dynamics provided with the RiskFactorModelProvider. The generated stream of contract events contains all post-status date events that occur during the lifetime of the contract thus resulting in the contract's risk factor contingent lifecycle.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the lifecycle(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,ContractModel model, RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTimes - a series of analysis times
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        riskFactorModel - an external model of the risk factor dynamics
        Returns:
        the contract's contingent lifecycle
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

      • lifecycle

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> lifecycle(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,
                                                 ContractModelProvider model)
                                          throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                                 AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates the non-contingent part of the contract's lifecycle

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of contract events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type. The generated stream of contract events contains all post-status date events that occur during the lifetime of the contract but are not contingent upon any risk factor dynamics thus resulting in the contract's non-contingent lifecycle.

        The non-contingent contract lifecycle evaluates the legal logic of the respective Contract Type along the contract's lifetime up to the point in time where the first risk factor contingent contract event occurs. Therefore, the non-contingent contract lifecycle matches the portion of the contingent lifecycle up to the first contingent event. Further, for a contract with purely non-contingent events (e.g. a PrincipalAtMaturity without RateReset, Scaling, CreditDefault, etc.) contingent and non-contingent lifecycle are the same.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the lifecycle(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,ContractModel model) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTimes - a series of analysis times
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        Returns:
        the non-contingent part of the contract's lifecycle
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

      • payoff

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> payoff(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,
                                              ContractModelProvider model,
                                              RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel)
                                       throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                              AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates the contingent payoff of the contract

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of transaction events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type and contingent to the risk factor dynamics provided with the RiskFactorModelProvider. The generated stream of transaction events contains all post-status date transaction events that occur during the lifetime of the contract thus resulting in the contract's risk factor contingent payoff.

        Transaction events are a subset of contract events evaluated through the lifecycle methods that trigger actual transactions of units of assets (for financial contracts strictly cash in some currency) from one party to another. Therefore, a contract's payoff evaluates to a subset of contract events from its lifecycle.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the payoff(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,ContractModel model, RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTimes - a series of analysis times
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        riskFactorModel - an external model of the risk factor dynamics
        Returns:
        the contract's contingent payoff
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

      • payoff

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> payoff(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,
                                              ContractModelProvider model)
                                       throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                              AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates the non-contingent part of the contract's payoff

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of transaction events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type. The generated stream of transaction events contains all post-status date events that occur during the lifetime of the contract but are not contingent upon any risk factor dynamics thus resulting in the contract's non-contingent payoff.

        The non-contingent contract payoff evaluates the legal logic of the respective Contract Type along the contract's lifetime up to the point in time where the first risk factor contingent contract event (note, this can be any contract event, not only transaction events) occurs. Therefore, the non-contingent contract payoff matches the portion of the contingent payoff up to the first contingent event. Further, for a contract with purely non-contingent events (e.g. a PrincipalAtMaturity without RateReset, Scaling, CreditDefault, etc.) contingent and non-contingent payoff are the same.

        Transaction events are a subset of contract events evaluated through the lifecycle methods that trigger actual transactions of units of assets (for financial contracts strictly cash in some currency) from one party to another. Therefore, a contract's payoff evaluates to a subset of contract events from its lifecycle.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's payoff.

        This method invokes the payoff(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,ContractModel model) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTimes - a series of analysis times
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        Returns:
        the non-contingent part of the contract's payoff
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

      • events

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> events(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,
                                              ContractModelProvider model,
                                              RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel)
                                       throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                              AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates all contract events within a specified time window

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of contract events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type and contingent to the risk factor dynamics provided with the RiskFactorModelProvider. The generated stream of contract events contains all post-status date events that occur within the window of times specified.

        The window of contract events is taken as the time period from time analysisTimes.stream().min(Comparator.naturalOrder()) to time analysisTimes.stream().max(Comparator.naturalOrder()) including limits.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the events(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,ContractModel model, RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTimes - a series of analysis times
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        riskFactorModel - an external model of the risk factor dynamics
        Returns:
        the contract's contingent lifecycle
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

      • events

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> events(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,
                                              ContractModelProvider model)
                                       throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                              AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates the non-contingent contract events within a time window

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of contract events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type. The generated stream of contract events contains all post-status date events that occur within the window of times specified.

        The window of times is taken as the time period from time analysisTimes.stream().min(Comparator.naturalOrder()) to time analysisTimes.stream().max(Comparator.naturalOrder()) including limits.

        The non-contingent window of contract events evaluates the legal logic of the respective Contract Type within the time window up to the point in time where the first risk factor contingent contract event occurs. Therefore, the non-contingent window of contract events matches the portion of the contingent window of contract events up to the first contingent event. Further, for a contract with purely non-contingent events (e.g. a PrincipalAtMaturity without RateReset, Scaling, CreditDefault, etc.) contingent and non-contingent window of contract events are the same.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the events(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,ContractModel model) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTimes - a series of analysis times
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        Returns:
        the non-contingent part of the contract's lifecycle
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

      • events

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> events(LocalDateTime analysisTime,
                                              Period period,
                                              ContractModelProvider model,
                                              RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel)
                                       throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                              AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates all contract events within a time period

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of contract events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type and contingent to the risk factor dynamics provided with the RiskFactorModelProvider. The generated stream of contract events contains all post-status date events that occur within the window of times specified through a window start date and time period.

        The window of contract events is taken as the time period from time analysisTimes to time analysisTimes.plus(period) including limits.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the events(LocalDateTime analysisTime,Period period, ContractModel model, RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTime - a single analysis time marking the window start
        period - the period within which events are evaluated
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        riskFactorModel - an external model of the risk factor dynamics
        Returns:
        the contract's contingent lifecycle
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

      • events

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> events(LocalDateTime analysisTime,
                                              Period period,
                                              ContractModelProvider model)
                                       throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                              AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates the non-contingent contract events within a time period

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of contract events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type. The generated stream of contract events contains all post-status date events that occur within the window of times specified through a window start date and time period.

        The window of contract events is taken as the time period from time analysisTimes to time analysisTimes.plus(period) including limits.

        The non-contingent window of contract events evaluates the legal logic of the respective Contract Type within the time window up to the point in time where the first risk factor contingent contract event occurs. Therefore, the non-contingent window of contract events matches the portion of the contingent window of contract events up to the first contingent event. Further, for a contract with purely non-contingent events (e.g. a PrincipalAtMaturity without RateReset, Scaling, CreditDefault, etc.) contingent and non-contingent window of contract events are the same.

        For time analysisTime an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the events(LocalDateTime analysisTime,Period period,ContractModel model) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTime - a single analysis time marking the window start
        period - the period within which events are evaluated
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        Returns:
        the non-contingent part of the contract's lifecycle
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

      • transactions

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> transactions(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes,
                                                    ContractModelProvider model,
                                                    RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel)
                                             throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                                    AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates all transaction events within a specified time window

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of transaction events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type and contingent to the risk factor dynamics provided with the RiskFactorModelProvider. The generated stream of transaction events contains all post-status date transaction events that occur within the window of times specified.

        The window of transaction events is taken as the time period from time analysisTimes.stream().min(Comparator.naturalOrder()) to time analysisTimes.stream().max(Comparator.naturalOrder()) including limits.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the transactions(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes, ContractModel model, RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTimes - a series of analysis times
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        riskFactorModel - an external model of the risk factor dynamics
        Returns:
        the transaction events within the time window

        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type

                                             throws ContractTypeUnknownException,

        Evaluates the non-contingent transaction events within a time window

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of transaction events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type. The generated stream of transaction events contains all post-status date transaction events that occur within the window of times specified.

        The window of times is taken as the time period from time analysisTimes.stream().min(Comparator.naturalOrder()) to time analysisTimes.stream().max(Comparator.naturalOrder()) including limits.

        The non-contingent window of transaction events evaluates the legal logic of the respective Contract Type within the time window up to the point in time where the first risk factor contingent contract event occurs. Therefore, the non-contingent window of transaction events matches the portion of the contingent window of transaction events up to the first contingent contract event. Further, for a contract with purely non-contingent events (e.g. a PrincipalAtMaturity without RateReset, Scaling, CreditDefault, etc.) contingent and non-contingent window of transaction events are the same.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the transactions(Set<LocalDateTime> analysisTimes, ContractModel model) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Evaluates all transaction events within a time period

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of transaction events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type and contingent to the risk factor dynamics provided with the RiskFactorModelProvider. The generated stream of transaction events contains all post-status date transaction events that occur within the window of times specified through a window start date and time period.

        The window of transaction events is taken as the time period from time analysisTimes to time analysisTimes.plus(period) including limits.

        For each time in argument analysisTimes an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the transactions(LocalDateTime analysisTime, Period period, ContractModel model, RiskFactorModelProvider riskFactorModel) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

      • transactions

        public static ArrayList<ContractEvent> transactions(LocalDateTime analysisTime,
                                                    Period period,
                                                    ContractModelProvider model)
                                             throws ContractTypeUnknownException,
                                                    AttributeConversionException
        Evaluates the non-contingent transaction events within a time period

        The set of contract attributes are mapped to a stream of transaction events according to the legal logic of the respective Contract Type. The generated stream of transaction events contains all post-status date transaction events that occur within the window of times specified through a window start date and time period.

        The window of transaction events is taken as the time period from time analysisTimes to time analysisTimes.plus(period) including limits.

        The non-contingent window of transaction events evaluates the legal logic of the respective Contract Type within the time window up to the point in time where the first risk factor contingent contract event occurs. Therefore, the non-contingent window of transaction events matches the portion of the window of contingent transaction events up to the first contingent event. Further, for a contract with purely non-contingent events (e.g. a PrincipalAtMaturity without RateReset, Scaling, CreditDefault, etc.) contingent and non-contingent window of transaction events are the same.

        For time analysisTime an analytical event is added to the lifecycle with the sole purpose of "collecting" the contract's inner states at that time. Therefore, the generated analytical events do not affect the contract's lifecycle.

        This method invokes the transactions(LocalDateTime analysisTime, Period period, ContractModel model) method of the respective Contract Type-class as indicated by the ContractType attribute. If the ContractType attribute cannot be resolved to an ACTUS Contract Type the method throws a ContractTypeUnknownException.

        Parameters:
        analysisTime - a single analysis time marking the window start
        period - the period within which events are evaluated
        model - the model carrying the contract attributes
        Returns:
        the non-contingent transaction events within the time period specified
        Throws:
        ContractTypeUnknownException - if the provided ContractType field in the ContractModelProvider cannot be resolved
        AttributeConversionException - if and attribute in ContractModelProvider cannot be converted to its target data type
